title: What is the best course to learn React? It would be good if it's project oriented. - Quora

response.answer_text: I’d like to enthusiastically recommend Colt Steele’s React Bootcamp, which you can find right here: The Modern React Bootcamp (Hooks, Context, NextJS, Router) That’s a great course, and very project-driven. The projects can be a lot of fun, too. I originally learned React from the official docs and tutorials but I ended up doing Colt’s course later on and it answered a lot of questions that I had. Colt also teaches some useful design patterns that aren’t in the docs. I ended up supplementing his course with another one by Stephen Grider when I wanted to integrate Redux into a project. Colt covers Redux a bit in his course but that workflow is more complex and Grider takes more time to explain it. You can find that course here: Modern React with Redux Training Course You should be able to get both courses for under $20 each. If you see a different price, just Google “Udemy Coupon.” Good luck!
